intro: Statice palmyrensis, commonly known as the Palmyrene statice, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, which bloom during the summer months. It is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and can tolerate high temperatures and low water availability. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in Mediterranean climates.
